brief_description: Seasonal influenza vaccine study with Murine subject
brief_title: Immune Responses to Seasonal Influenza Vaccination in Mouse model
description: Seasonal influenza vaccine study with Murine subject
endpoints: Blood, spleen and lymph node samples prior to vaccination and daily sampling up to 10 days post vaccination
hypothesis: To understand and describe the multidimensional murine immune response to vaccination
objectives: Design and conduct in vivo murine experiments to build, identify and experimentally validate the proposed immune response models by generating high frequency sampling and high dimensional datasets from mice with TIV vaccinations.
official_title: Immune Responses to Seasonal Influenza Vaccination in Mouse model

arm.description: Pool of mice primed with A/New Caledonia/20/99 (H1N1) inactivated whole virus and after 30-60 days boosted with 2006-07 TIV (A/New Caledonia/20/99 (H1N1), A/Wisconsin/67/2005-like (H3N2), and B/Malaysia/2506/2004-like viruses).
arm.name: Murine-TIV

personnel.organization: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling
University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling

program.contract_name: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling II
